title: Confusing log message when weak subjectivity checkpoint not specified
body:
# üêû Bug Report

### Description

When a prysm node is started up without a weak subjectivity checkpoint, the following log message is emited:
```
[2022-06-08 12:17:33]  INFO blockchain: No checkpoint for syncing provided, node will begin syncing from genesis. Checkpoint Sync is an optional feature that allows your node to sync from a more recent checkpoint, which enhances the security of your local beacon node and the broader network. See https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/next/prysm-usage/checkpoint-sync/ to learn how to configure Checkpoint Sync.
```

This is a vestige of a previous iteration of checkpoint sync where weak subjectivity checkpoints were used. The bit about syncing from genesis is misleading, and the rest of it is worded too strongly - we shouldn't complain about weak subjectivity checkpoints not being specified when checkpoint sync doesn't really support them due to lacking a backfill capability.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

while this log made a little more sense in the old model of checkpoint sync, it was never accurate to say the lack of a ws checkpoint would cause the node to sync from genesis.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

```
bazel run //cmd/beacon-chain -- \
--prater \
--datadir=/var/lib/prysm/prater/checkpoint-sync \
--checkpoint-sync-url=http://localhost:3500 \
--genesis-beacon-api-url=http://localhost:3500 \
--enable-debug-rpc-endpoints \
--grpc-max-msg-size=55568081 \
--http-web3provider=http://localhost:8545 \
--monitoring-port=8081 \
--p2p-tcp-port=13001 \
--p2p-udp-port=12001 \
--pprofport=6061 \
--grpc-gateway-port=3501 \
--rpc-port=4001 \
--genesis-state /var/lib/prysm/prater/genesis.ssz \
--accept-terms-of-use
```

## üî• Error

see log message in issue description.

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

`v2.1.3-rc.3`
